title: HASH DAO ($HASH) Whitepaper
body:
**What is HASH DAO?**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GZGhkHR8hf7SHJqZ6sW1K.png?height=558&width=997)

***Updated : May 2022***

Mission : Develop a DAO to help create a system that can assist craft cannabis brands, manufacturers, and operators. Centered around on-chain ESG metrics, HASH DAO is focused on providing a growing open-source library of genetics, farming methods, hash processing, entheogenic plant treatment, and community healing protocols available through a multi-tiered token.

**Creating the Future of Tech, Innovation, & Culture**

Highly Autonomous Systems of Horticulture (**$HASH**) : Utilizing smart contracts to automate and democratize production, supply chain, and governance in the cannabis & psychedelic Industry.

We created $HASH to allow the craft growers who put the plant first and under-represented communities easier access into the cannabis space and the emerging technologies of Web3.

*“Decades of marijuana prohibition and high incarceration rates for marijuana convictions has left many people out of the legal marijuana boom.”*

> **Barriers of Entry + (Profit > People) = Current State of the Cannabis Space**

The multi-billion dollar cannabis industry is entering it’s boom phase as more global cannabis markets arise and support for [U.S. federal legalization](https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/3617) continues to grow support, in 2020 alone the cannabis space grew to over $20 Billion and is projected to 10x in the next decade.

Malpractice and gatekeeping of the cannabis industry has traditionally maximized profits at the cost of the plant or people, and in turn have provided barriers to entry to craft cannabis farmers and the BIPOC community.

Corporate cannabis companies operate and control the majority of the space, leaving legacy operators and small brands without capital solutions to scale their businesses and do not take into consideration all of it’s stakeholders :

* The Growers & Phenotype Hunters
* Cannabis Processing & Technology
* Dispensaries & Deliveries
* Consumers & Community
* Mother Earth

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/oXXVXLuIXOQoXtXRqzBXV.png?height=621&width=904)

The majority of the craft cannabis space, lacks in metrics and does not reward innovation or intellectual property; often operating at the cost of the patient, plant and the planet.

Cancerous pesticides, mold, and in-organic genetically modified flowers have all been out-dated practices utilized in current cannabis horticulture. This is largely due to a profit-driven model of the medicinal plant which has unjustly fined small legacy growers. Incarceration of the BIPOC community for alternative medicine use at a disproportionate rate has since gate-kept entry into the space.

Farming, hash-processing, and cannabis tech are often driven to innovation by financial corporate investors, many times leaving most of the developers, designers, and legacy growers at the short end of the intellectual property stick. Elite genetics are identified by farmers through years of R/D sorting through phenotypes of each strain. Many times big brands  exploit years of hard work and value that passionate master growers put in and often don’t receive proper credit. Certain strains go on to become cultural identities that generate massive value, I.E. the creators and farmers innovate and the investors profit off their intellectual property, currently there is no on-chain authentication process.

Although track-and-trace is currently implemented, most cannabis brands are not completely transparent with their grow methods and techniques of production. There is also massive risk for current cannabis businesses as they have become targets for robberies the past few years. Legal brands are facing counterfeits and knock-offs in the black market. With the integration of digital identities, NFTs/Web3 purchasing, and automation, many of these problems are easily solved.

![Exclusive Libraries of Genetics & Phenos](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-8T4OrLTcNOJxW2vLerl-.jpg?height=1866&width=1536)

*Solution?* Creating community-ownership of the vertically-integrated $HASH Supply Chain of production, processing, distributing, and operating on-chain craft cannabis  compliance geared toward Web3 adoption. Information, data security, and their applications are essential for business optimization and transparency. Although there are many ERP solutions for the industry already, our governance will be centered around cannabis supply chain and DeFi dApps that utilize NFT-based SKU’s to generate active product data and create on-chain interactions that comply with ESG metrics, paving the way for global regulations and the future of the cannabis space.

Developing Horticulture Public Goods : BIPOC Horticulture Initiative, Open-Source Library of Genetics, Strains and Phenos, Regenerative Farming Methods & Techniques, Cannabis Production, Processing, Entheogenic Cultivation, Medicinal Protocols, and a Community-Practitioner Directory

Community-Governance over the liquidity, yield-farming, and major-user decisions in the tokenization of HASH DAO.

HASH DAO Governance is the future of the industry standard, and to do this we will start by partnering with one successful Emerald Triangle, Northern California craft cannabis-brand with community-staking of its future scaling of operations and expanding a compilation of automation protocols through smart contracts.

**ON-CHAIN SUPPLY NFTs + ACTIVE INVENTORY TRACKING + CRYPTO TRANSACTIONS = Web3 PoS**

**World’s First Cannabis DAO Founded On**:

BIPOC-equity and engineered around community-development governed by craft cannabis operators, backed by IRL projects.

**On-Chain Protocols + Smart Contracts = The Automated Horticulture of Tomorrow**

Creating a future:

* Geared to the love and cultivation of the plant and Mother Earth
* Onboarding BIPOC leaders and creatives onto the blockchain
* Compensating intellectual property proportionally to fulfill smart contracts

> **HASH DAO = Power Back in Your Hands**

Reinvention of the Horticulture Supply Chain and Data Distribution via smart contracts that allow for automation and help individuals to create ownership over community-led projects, intellectual property, digital assets, and dApps.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/M6C2p0sNHx37p783TEv9D.jpg?height=822&width=1125)

**First Wins for HASH DAO**

> “Community Ownership of Physical and Digital Assets”

Minting a multi-tiered HASH DAO NFT with the diamond governance tier going for $10 K, raising a total of $11.5 M for an initial $HASH treasury. As funds become available, proceeds will immediately go to partnering with South Face Mangement to purchase over 30+ acres in Mendocino and 40+ acres Humbolt County. This will include the scaling of a vertically-integrated nursery and farm as well as it’s statewide distribution of award-winning products under Uncle Mac’s brand and South Face Farms Management.

**Project #1 :**  Carry out renovation on the farm and nursery to ensure full-scale ESG-metric compliance and how to bring all aspects of the farm and it’s production on-chain, from SKU NFT’s to utilizing energy consumption data for carbon credit checks. Partnering with Uncle Mac’s, a Northern California craft cannabis brand, & South Face Management, parent company to Flower Wheel Nursery, South Face Farms Cultivation, and Uncle Mac’s brand.

**Project #2 :** Onboard visual and 3D artists who will design branding and assets for the Metaverse and we develop cross-chain NFT’s to be dropped on various play-to-earn games. We will also be acquiring digital plots of real estate to build “Metaverse farms” and “digital dispensaries” where a user can view the product, find out all of it’s information, and have it eventually delivered through an on-chain transaction. Along with digital land we will also be investing in domain names, including various strain names, cannabis celebrities, and psychedelic culture. Explore liquidity pools and yield farming with assets and treasury.

**Project #3 :** Developing the Whitethorne Wash House, operating at an Emerald Triangle legacy property. This on-chain Hash House, the home lab for Uncle Mac’s brand hash production, will operate as a wholesale fresh frozen supply chain solution for transportation, storage, distribution and hash toll processing.

**Project #4** : Getting $HASH in your hands. This is our farm-to-table craft cannabis buyers club providing direct-to-consumer access to exclusive SKU’s from legacy brands in the Emerald Triangle. This will include obtaining a retail and event license to launch Nephew’s Automated.

**Project #5 :** Aggregating a library of horticulture public goods & building the Biodiversity BIPOC Glamping Learning Initiative; start building Marijuana for Minorities Program to co-create $HASH University creating content with some of the best small-batch growers and washers in the industry. (Community Online Education)

**Project #6 :** Nephew’s will be applying for its event space license building the foundation for Akasha, an immersive psychedelic A/R Lounge for BIPOC community healing. The distribution and delivery will be a warehouse that will have an on-chain ESG-metric system in the back and a public access immersive art space in the front. We will also be looking into developing a portfolio of boutique cannabis bud and breakfasts in emerging global cannabis markets.

**Project #7 :** We will be finding ERP solutions to develop state-of-the-art horticulture automation and Web3 technologies, based upon on-chain governance and compliance, to pave the way for the international industry standard by working towards meeting ESG-metric compliance. Our final goal is developing complete automation systems without compromising craft horticulture. From driverless deliveries, farm drone surveillance & data collection to utilize machine-learning and AI and to understand buyer behavior, horticulture improvements, growth optimization, etc.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QcqQLT4DyBHuQRaaputgr.png?height=560&width=997)

title: Shuangliang energy-saving co signing photovoltaic large single industry has gradually become clear
body:
On May 9, Shuangliang energy conservation announced that its wholly-owned subsidiary signed a long single silicon wafer sales contract with Dongfang Risheng with an amount of 14.227 billion yuan that night. The announcement also said that a few days earlier, Shuangliang energy conservation also signed orders for crystalline silicon reduction furnace of more than 324 million yuan.

According to the announcement released by Shuangliang energy conservation on the 9th, Dongfang Risheng expects to purchase 1.572 billion monocrystalline silicon chips from the wholly-owned subsidiary of Shuangliang energy conservation from 2022 to 2024.

At the beginning of 2021, Shuangliang energy conservation entered the silicon wafer market. Since this year, the company has deepened the layout of photovoltaic field, promoted the differentiated development of photovoltaic business, and realized strategic coordination with the industrial chain. While opening up orders, Shuangliang’s energy-saving industry gradually became clear, forming two “carbon neutral” related sectors of “energy conservation and water saving” and “new energy”.

Shuangliang energy conservation said that since the company started the silicon wafer business, it has signed long silicon material purchase orders with Xinte, ASI, Jiangsu Zhongneng and other enterprises, and the silicon material supply has always been stable. In addition to solid orders on hand, the technical advantages and continuous iteration of the silicon wafer business also continue to ensure the market development ability of the business. So far, Shuangliang energy conservation has signed a long silicon wafer / silicon rod order, with an amount of about 77.9 billion yuan.

According to the announcement on the 9th, the subject of another single contract signed by Shuangliang energy conservation is a multi pair rod polysilicon reduction furnace, with a contract amount of 324 million yuan. In the field of reduction furnace, Shuangliang energy-saving ploughing takes longer. Shuangliang energy saving was founded in 1982. After going public in 2003, it began to layout photovoltaic business and provide polysilicon reduction furnace for downstream silicon wafer manufacturers. In 2022, the amount of newly signed orders for polysilicon reduction furnace has reached 1.886 billion yuan.

It is understood that Shuangliang energy conservation also continues to promote upstream and downstream cooperation in the industrial chain, forming an industrial layout from “series” to “parallel” with reduction furnace customers, silicon wafer customers and component customers.

Today, the photovoltaic business has brought strong performance growth to Shuangliang energy conservation. In the first quarter of this year, Shuangliang energy conservation achieved an operating revenue of 1.734 billion yuan, a year-on-year increase of 299.5%.

The relevant person in charge of Shuangliang energy conservation said that with rich industry experience and close customer relationship, the company will build a new growth pole, so as to accelerate the strategic layout from professional equipment manufacturers to zero carbon green energy solution providers.

## How built-in culture helps DAOs blur the line between work and play.

### This is the last blogpost drafted and posted by Blessing Jemimah Jones Akpan, a Content Creator who was about to be elected for getting the Dream DAO membership, given their interests and dreams that were connected to our mission. Their inputs to developing the editorials and to the Dream DAO as a whole are respected, valued and shall be forever remembered by the community. One must say that the world's best workspace is not possible without the world's best people like them, and while the void is deep, they left a Polaris to look up to.

Unless you’re secretly a billionaire — or Elon Musk — you probably want to work at your dream job one day (read: every day).

There are a few challenges with doing that.

1. You’ll have to figure out *what* your dream job is, which is a little more challenging than it sounds.
2. When you’ve figured out your dream job — and you might’ve guessed this — finding that place and getting hired for the role you want is a *LOT* more challenging than it sounds.

I’ve always known that I didn’t have it in me to work a toxic full-time \*\*\*\*job.

I also know that those sorts of jobs permeate Nigeria’s job market, giving workers fewer good options than they deserve.

Being able to pick the sort of jobs I work at is a privilege I am forever grateful for; most of my working life has been with amazing companies and organizations with kind, caring coworkers.

Good for me, right? Why should *you* care?

**Well…**

* **With epic storyteller dramaticism**

I found the *one place* where you will ALWAYS love your job.

![](https://arman-singh.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fs3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2Fsecure.notion-static.com%2F607c6a4a-f010-4486-beb9-bc5497ad642b%2FUntitled.png?table=block&id=053f65a4-ee9b-4ff5-8c14-46a5727c956f&spaceId=5b3628d7-4583-46a9-91ac-1f9c05a76fb9&width=1200&userId=&cache=v2)

I’ve **discovered the world’s best workplace**, guaranteed to make you laugh, cry (good tears), and scream to the skies that you’re the happiest person on Earth.

# **The World’s Best Workplace: Web2 vs. Regen DAOs**

First off, “Web2” is a fancy way of referring to the internet as we know it. Big tech companies control the platforms and tools we use every day — from Google’s search engine to Meta’s suite of social apps to the app you’re reading this article on.

They own the platforms. They make the rules.

This contrasts starkly with “Web3,” which uses [peer-to-peer technology](https://ntkris.substack.com/p/what-can-web3-solve-for-users?s=r) to let people access anything on the internet without giving up power to one person.

The next thing you want to know about is the meaning of “DAO.” A DAO is a community of people working on Web3 who prefer to be autonomous.

They don’t like big tech owning all the most used internet software, and they don’t want to follow rules that may not be in their best interests as users.

“DAO” is an acronym for Decentralised Autonomous Organisation:

* “Decentralised” = “There isn’t one person in charge. Everyone can be in charge.”
* “Autonomous” = “We make our own rules.”
* The word organization shares that it’s not a company but a group of people aligned to one goal.

There are hundreds of DAOs, and each one is creating projects that help you do anything from save the environment to travel luxuriously.

Here’s the last thing you should know.

“Regen,” aka regenerative\*,\* means a lot of things. Their sum is “**practices that use Web3 to improve the world for *everyone’s* benefit**.”

Therefore, a Regen DAO is a decentralized, autonomous organization that uses Web3 to improve the world for everyone’s benefit.

I mentioned earlier that, on Web2, the people who own the platform make the rules. That can be a bad thing, and here’s an example from my life.

In early 2020, I applied to volunteer with a large org working on a cause I care deeply about.

My role was at the grassroots level — I would interact directly with the kids we were helping through the organization’s key program, report to directors in my region (community leaders I looked up to), and help reach more young participants.

I was stoked.

… for all of two weeks.

Barely a fortnight after I joined, the org was draining me. I got near midnight calls and messages from program participants (I didn’t sign up for these, but someone needed to take them) and was pressured into working as late as 3 am on tasks assigned to my team.

I was burning out.

Fast.

On top of all this, I had life and online school to think about, but the org didn’t have a system to let me reduce my hours or share my needs, and my only other teammate was even more burnt out than I was.

The most stressful part of the endeavor — and the one that made me quit first thing in the morning after a crying, screaming breakdown at 2 a.m. in my mother’s dining room — was that the deadlines were unachievable for anyone but [Kyle XY](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyle_XY).

I had come into the org wanting to use excellent marketing to further the cause but rarely had time to think of my personal social content goals, much less post anything for them.

Our manager was toxic. They beat volunteers down verbally and then gaslit workers into thinking of the verbal abuse as “constructive feedback.” This manager’s superior communicated with and deferred to them in all things, so volunteers had no one to turn to.

I quit. Obviously.

But that situation could have been so much better. You’ll find the key problems from that story in almost every company at various levels of solved-ness. Let’s call them **the Workplace Ruinators**.

I haven’t encountered a regen DAO with this problem because most DAO models work using “contributors” instead of “hires.”

A contributor has more role flexibility than a hire ever can from the get-go. In most cases, you can look at what a DAO is doing and contribute if it appeals to you.

Then you choose *how* you want to contribute. The DAO may pay you per project, with a salary, a stipend, or a mix of each, depending on how it operates.

What happens if you change your mind about how you want to contribute?

You switch it up. Contributors tackle a problem or provide a needed service within a DAO: You’re golden as long as you can help.

***Workplace Ruin averted.***

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1192/1\*ZksPAFlrW25Uw7w5Cgqfdw.jpeg)

Not every regen DAO operates with contributors alone. But when they do, you’re asking for a specific role in a project you’re genuinely psyched about, so you don’t have to deal with aspects of the job that make you go “eek.”

In regen DAOs, work is not assigned. You ask for it or are invited. (Invited here is *an actual invite*. None of that passive-aggressive, “We’re pretending you have a choice” stuff.)

And, if you’re on a project where you like *some* of the work — but not all of it — there’s almost always going to be a contributor eager to help by doing the thing you dislike.

All DAOs promote a fast, collaborative, “make it happen” culture. Picture yourself in that environment: a contract or full-time worker doing work you don’t like or cannot excel at.

Regen DAO leaders and other collaborators are glad (read: completely understanding and *happy)* to take such work off your hands.

How does this situation play out in a Regen DAO?

**On having fun at work:** Web3 is meme culture at its best. Regen web3 is even better: Everyone appreciates the value of a workplace where all contributors feel valued, accepted, and heard. And, like GitcoinDAOs [Memeapalooza](https://twitter.com/GitcoinDAO/status/1499827748117913604?t=g2L1tjf7QW-smrFldJ31_Q&s=19) event, everyone *has fun*.

**On communicating with managers and sharing ideas without anxiety:** DAO contributors in leadership are paradigms of this culture; using a “Yes, and” mentality when faced with new ideas, facilitating collaboration, and ensuring everyone is aware of the resources available to them. DreamDAO co-founder Gary Sheng is a great example:

Gary’s reflections while learning in public.

Leaders like Sean Mannis of Gitcoin’s MMM (Merch, Memes, and Marketing) workstream push for workplace innovation that makes it easy to get constructive feedback and recognition from your peers and do work that fits in your life.

Sounds fantastic.

**On inclusion and diversity**

I can’t 100% say that every Regen DAO does its best to make a workplace that is openly inclusive. However, they *do* create environments that scorn prejudice and marginalization. They also create environments where anyone feels encouraged to propose a project changing things that may make people feel unsafe to be themselves.

Most importantly, all this is decentralized. Everyone gets a say in who leads, how they lead, and what they do. Gitcoin founder Kevin Owocki puts it best [when he says](https://gov.gitcoin.co/t/consent-of-the-governed-and-legitimacy-by-process-in-gitcoindao/9778), “The consent of the governed is the only legitimate basis for government.”

# **Final Thoughts**

Doing work you genuinely love should be easier than it is today. As humans, we should only have to do work stuff that we *actually enjoy* in workplaces that make it easy to be happy.

I found these sorts of workplaces as an independent editor at [Craft Your Content](https://www.craftyourcontent.com/) and a writer at [Coin Central](https://coincentral.com/author/jemimah-jones/), both Web2-native companies.

It’s not impossible. It’s just easier when you work in regen Web3.

**Things to note:**

1. If you’re a manager at a traditional web2 company, consider that your team members (and company) will benefit from applying some principles in this post.
2. If you’re like me, looking for the world’s best workplaces, consider contributing to a regen DAO. Here’s [how to contribute to GitcoinDAO](https://www.notion.so/8035f41cf1194022b03c579791f32ca7), where I work.
3. If you do not consider anything I’ve shared, please consider avoiding situations that lead to Zombified-Worker Syndrome. You deserve better.

title: HASH DAO ($HASH) Whitepaper
body:
**What is HASH DAO?**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GZGhkHR8hf7SHJqZ6sW1K.png?height=558&width=997)

***Updated : May 2022***

Mission : Develop a DAO to help create a system that can assist craft cannabis brands, manufacturers, and operators. Centered around on-chain ESG metrics, HASH DAO is focused on providing a growing open-source library of genetics, farming methods, hash processing, entheogenic plant treatment, and community healing protocols available through a multi-tiered token.

**Creating the Future of Tech, Innovation, & Culture**

Highly Autonomous Systems of Horticulture (**$HASH**) : Utilizing smart contracts to automate and democratize production, supply chain, and governance in the cannabis & psychedelic Industry.

We created $HASH to allow the craft growers who put the plant first and under-represented communities easier access into the cannabis space and the emerging technologies of Web3.

*“Decades of marijuana prohibition and high incarceration rates for marijuana convictions has left many people out of the legal marijuana boom.”*

> **Barriers of Entry + (Profit > People) = Current State of the Cannabis Space**

The multi-billion dollar cannabis industry is entering it’s boom phase as more global cannabis markets arise and support for [U.S. federal legalization](https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/3617) continues to grow support, in 2020 alone the cannabis space grew to over $20 Billion and is projected to 10x in the next decade.

Malpractice and gatekeeping of the cannabis industry has traditionally maximized profits at the cost of the plant or people, and in turn have provided barriers to entry to craft cannabis farmers and the BIPOC community.

Corporate cannabis companies operate and control the majority of the space, leaving legacy operators and small brands without capital solutions to scale their businesses and do not take into consideration all of it’s stakeholders :

* The Growers & Phenotype Hunters
* Cannabis Processing & Technology
* Dispensaries & Deliveries
* Consumers & Community
* Mother Earth

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/oXXVXLuIXOQoXtXRqzBXV.png?height=621&width=904)

The majority of the craft cannabis space, lacks in metrics and does not reward innovation or intellectual property; often operating at the cost of the patient, plant and the planet.

Cancerous pesticides, mold, and in-organic genetically modified flowers have all been out-dated practices utilized in current cannabis horticulture. This is largely due to a profit-driven model of the medicinal plant which has unjustly fined small legacy growers. Incarceration of the BIPOC community for alternative medicine use at a disproportionate rate has since gate-kept entry into the space.

Farming, hash-processing, and cannabis tech are often driven to innovation by financial corporate investors, many times leaving most of the developers, designers, and legacy growers at the short end of the intellectual property stick. Elite genetics are identified by farmers through years of R/D sorting through phenotypes of each strain. Many times big brands  exploit years of hard work and value that passionate master growers put in and often don’t receive proper credit. Certain strains go on to become cultural identities that generate massive value, I.E. the creators and farmers innovate and the investors profit off their intellectual property, currently there is no on-chain authentication process.

Although track-and-trace is currently implemented, most cannabis brands are not completely transparent with their grow methods and techniques of production. There is also massive risk for current cannabis businesses as they have become targets for robberies the past few years. Legal brands are facing counterfeits and knock-offs in the black market. With the integration of digital identities, NFTs/Web3 purchasing, and automation, many of these problems are easily solved.

![Exclusive Libraries of Genetics & Phenos](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-8T4OrLTcNOJxW2vLerl-.jpg?height=1866&width=1536)

*Solution?* Creating community-ownership of the vertically-integrated $HASH Supply Chain of production, processing, distributing, and operating on-chain craft cannabis  compliance geared toward Web3 adoption. Information, data security, and their applications are essential for business optimization and transparency. Although there are many ERP solutions for the industry already, our governance will be centered around cannabis supply chain and DeFi dApps that utilize NFT-based SKU’s to generate active product data and create on-chain interactions that comply with ESG metrics, paving the way for global regulations and the future of the cannabis space.

Developing Horticulture Public Goods : BIPOC Horticulture Initiative, Open-Source Library of Genetics, Strains and Phenos, Regenerative Farming Methods & Techniques, Cannabis Production, Processing, Entheogenic Cultivation, Medicinal Protocols, and a Community-Practitioner Directory

Community-Governance over the liquidity, yield-farming, and major-user decisions in the tokenization of HASH DAO.

HASH DAO Governance is the future of the industry standard, and to do this we will start by partnering with one successful Emerald Triangle, Northern California craft cannabis-brand with community-staking of its future scaling of operations and expanding a compilation of automation protocols through smart contracts.

**ON-CHAIN SUPPLY NFTs + ACTIVE INVENTORY TRACKING + CRYPTO TRANSACTIONS = Web3 PoS**

**World’s First Cannabis DAO Founded On**:

BIPOC-equity and engineered around community-development governed by craft cannabis operators, backed by IRL projects.

**On-Chain Protocols + Smart Contracts = The Automated Horticulture of Tomorrow**

Creating a future:

* Geared to the love and cultivation of the plant and Mother Earth
* Onboarding BIPOC leaders and creatives onto the blockchain
* Compensating intellectual property proportionally to fulfill smart contracts

> **HASH DAO = Power Back in Your Hands**

Reinvention of the Horticulture Supply Chain and Data Distribution via smart contracts that allow for automation and help individuals to create ownership over community-led projects, intellectual property, digital assets, and dApps.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/M6C2p0sNHx37p783TEv9D.jpg?height=822&width=1125)

**First Wins for HASH DAO**

> “Community Ownership of Physical and Digital Assets”

Minting a multi-tiered HASH DAO NFT with the top governance tier going for $10 K, raising a total of $11.5 M for an initial $HASH treasury. As funds become available, proceeds will immediately go to partnering with South Face Mangement to purchase over 30+ acres in Mendocino and 40+ acres Humbolt County. This will include the scaling of a vertically-integrated nursery and farm as well as it’s statewide distribution of award-winning products under Uncle Mac’s brand and South Face Farms Management.

**Project #1 :**  Carry out renovation on the farm and nursery to ensure full-scale ESG-metric compliance and how to bring all aspects of the farm and it’s production on-chain, from SKU NFT’s to utilizing energy consumption data for carbon credit checks. Partnering with Uncle Mac’s, a Northern California craft cannabis brand, & South Face Management, parent company to Flower Wheel Nursery, South Face Farms Cultivation, and Uncle Mac’s brand.

**Project #2 :** Onboard visual and 3D artists who will design branding and assets for the Metaverse and we develop cross-chain NFT’s to be dropped on various play-to-earn games. We will also be acquiring digital plots of real estate to build “Metaverse farms” and “digital dispensaries” where a user can view the product, find out all of it’s information, and have it eventually delivered through an on-chain transaction. Along with digital land we will also be investing in domain names, including various strain names, cannabis celebrities, and psychedelic culture. Explore liquidity pools and yield farming with assets and treasury.

**Project #3 :** Developing the Whitethorne Wash House, operating at an Emerald Triangle legacy property. This on-chain Hash House, the home lab for Uncle Mac’s brand hash production, will operate as a wholesale fresh frozen supply chain solution for transportation, storage, distribution and hash toll processing.

**Project #4** : Getting $HASH in your hands. This is our farm-to-table craft cannabis buyers club providing direct-to-consumer access to exclusive SKU’s from legacy brands in the Emerald Triangle. This will include obtaining a retail and event license to launch Nephew’s Automated.

**Project #5 :** Aggregating a library of horticulture public goods & building the Biodiversity BIPOC Glamping Learning Initiative; start building Marijuana for Minorities Program to co-create $HASH University creating content with some of the best small-batch growers and washers in the industry. (Community Online Education)

**Project #6 :** Nephew’s will be applying for its event space license building the foundation for Akasha, an immersive psychedelic A/R Lounge for BIPOC community healing. The distribution and delivery will be a warehouse that will have an on-chain ESG-metric system in the back and a public access immersive art space in the front. We will also be looking into developing a portfolio of boutique cannabis bud and breakfasts in emerging global cannabis markets.

**Project #7 :** We will be finding ERP solutions to develop state-of-the-art horticulture automation and Web3 technologies, based upon on-chain governance and compliance, to pave the way for the international industry standard by working towards meeting ESG-metric compliance. Our final goal is developing complete automation systems without compromising craft horticulture. From driverless deliveries, farm drone surveillance & data collection to utilize machine-learning and AI and to understand buyer behavior, horticulture improvements, growth optimization, etc.

title: New consumption observation | Guochao Li Ning starts selling coffee | one trillion coffee market adds another cross-border giant | see you every day on the cover
body:
Cover news reporter Wu Yujia

Recently, Li Ning Sports (Shanghai) Co., Ltd. has applied for the registration of the trademark “Ning coffee”, officially announcing its entry into the coffee industry.

Should the leader of sports brand “Guochao” layout the coffee market? For a time, it has aroused widespread concern in the industry. There are different opinions on whether to play tickets or test the water. According to some insiders, coffee is more “embellishment” stores for Li Ning group, but others believe that this is opening up a new track.

During the discussion, Li Ning’s official response said: the company pays attention to the consumer purchase experience of retail terminals, hopes to improve customers’ comfort and experience during shopping by optimizing in store services, and provide coffee services in the store, which will be an innovative attempt of Li Ning for the consumer experience of retail terminals.

From the official response, coffee for Li Ning is more about improving the store experience than trying to open up a new track.

First of all, from a market perspective, coffee is one of the hottest consumption tracks in recent years. According to the data, in 2021, the scale of China’s coffee market was about 381.7 billion yuan. Some institutions predict that by 2025, the scale of the domestic coffee market will reach 1 trillion yuan, with a growth rate of 27.2%, far exceeding the global average of 2%. Facing the fast-growing track, capital has already poured in. According to data, from 2013 to 2021, coffee related projects were financed 114 times, with a disclosed amount of more than 11.5 billion yuan. Whether in terms of market scale or financing performance, the coffee track is worth Li Ning’s try.

Secondly, from the development stage, as an emerging industry, China’s coffee market is still in a relatively early stage. There are many domestic coffee brands. Starbucks, Tim Hortons, Costa and other international chain coffee brands are positioned as slow coffee scenes, focusing on the third space social networking; The “slow coffee camp” represented by% Arabica, m stand and seesaw is more about building brand awareness through stores, paying attention to the creation of aesthetic atmosphere, and taking high-quality coffee as its own; Novartis coffee, Ruixing coffee and man coffee are the representatives of high price coffee. The “fast coffee scene” is used to meet the needs of people who take coffee as their daily needs, and take the cost-effective route.

In addition, there are also some new cross-border players. Many industry giants such as “two barrels of oil”, China Post, Wanda, Tongrentang and even Goubuli have been involved in the coffee business one after another. In 2018, PetroChina established “Kunlun hospitality coffee” and sold freshly ground coffee in its Kunlun hospitality convenience store. In 2021, “hospitable coffee” opened more than 120 stores in 20 provinces and cities, with sales of more than 100 million yuan. The product line includes freshly ground coffee and ready to drink coffee. In 2019, Sinopec Yijie convenience store with nearly 30000 stores released a new brand “Yijie coffee”. In October 2019, Tongrentang Health Pharmaceutical Group’s new retail brand “Zhima health” experience store opened and launched medlar latte, Luohanguo American style and other “herbal” coffee. In February 2022, China Post announced that the country’s first post office coffee shop would officially land in Xiamen. On February 23, Tianjin “Goubuli steamed stuffed bun” also announced its entry into the Bureau and established gaoleya coffee.

What are Li Ning’s advantages in choosing to cross into the coffee track at this time? First, the number of stores. Compared with Ruixing with 6024 stores, Starbucks with 5654 stores in China and Nova coffee with more than 1500 stores in the same period, Li Ning coffee with more than 7000 outlets has certain advantages in scale. Once fully or partially launched, it is a force that can not be underestimated.

Secondly, different from the brand positioning of professional coffee making, the core logic behind Li Ning’s move is more similar to the business idea of resource reuse or new satisfaction of traffic. By improving the store experience, attracting young consumer groups and approaching generation Z, Li Ning’s national fashion image of China is strengthened.

Insiders pointed out that for brand entities, building scenes that consumers can experience and deeply perceive in time will become a key measure of market competition in the future.

As for whether this decision can really consolidate the brand barrier and become a new driving force for enterprises to move forward, it takes time to give the final answer.

title: In April, South Korea's semiconductor products exported US $10.9 billion, exceeding US $10 billion for 12 consecutive months
body:
According to the latest data released by the Ministry of science, information and communication technology of South Korea, the export volume of semiconductor products of South Korea reached US $10.9 billion in April this year, exceeding US $10 billion for 12 consecutive months.

In addition to semiconductors, panels are also an important export commodity of South Korea, with an export volume of US $2.05 billion in April. South Korea has two panel manufacturers, Samsung display and LG display, which have obvious advantages in OLED panels. They mainly supply the OLED panels required by Apple iPhone.

Driven by the strong export of semiconductors and panels, the export of ICT products in South Korea also increased significantly year-on-year in April. The data showed that it reached US $19.94 billion, compared with us $17.05 billion in the same period last year, a year-on-year increase of 16.9%.

The export volume of US $19.94 billion in April this year is the highest export volume of ICT products of South Korea in April since the release of relevant data in 1996.

Due to the strong demand for chips and panels in the overseas market, the export of ICT products in South Korea reached a new high of US $81.66 billion in the first four months of this year.

title: Love: don't let your beloved TA pass the preservation period
body:
We always habitually hide the people and things we love most carefully, and stubbornly think that we can always keep the beauty and the long joy at the moment, but we never know that happiness and joy are just a state of mind, and it also has a fresh-keeping period.

This article comes from wechat official account: man mood

Everything in life has a fresh-keeping period. If those beautiful feelings and wishes are only cherished and enshrined on the table of expectation, they can only be eclipsed by the dust accumulated in the abrasion of years.

An autumn rain, a cold. When the temperature dropped suddenly, I opened the wardrobe and wanted to turn over a thick cotton padded jacket to keep out the cold, but I accidentally found a clothes tightly wrapped in several layers of plastic bags in the corner of the drawer at the bottom of the wardrobe. What kind of clothes are you taking care of so carefully? I haven’t worn it for a long time. I almost forget it. So I carefully peeled off the outer package layer by layer. It turned out to be an outdated but still straight and gorgeous wool skirt. Suddenly, an indescribable emotion came to my mind. This beautiful wool skirt was once a favorite dress I bought a few years ago. It is expensive and exquisite. But because I like it so much, I don’t want to wear it more. I wear it on my body only a few days after the annual Chinese new year, attending friends’ banquets and attending important meetings. Then I take care of it carefully and put it in the cabinet, like a devout monk silently worshipping his God in my heart.

But the number of times I wear it is too small. Over time, I gradually forget its existence. Until today, I see it as new, but it is out of date and can’t wear it out anymore. The love for it and the joy of wearing it all dissipated in the abrasion of these years, leaving only infinite regret. If only I had worn it more than once!

too late to regret

We always habitually hide the people and things we love most carefully, and stubbornly think that we can always keep the beauty and the long joy at the moment, but we never know that happiness and joy are just a state of mind, and it also has a fresh-keeping period. If you don’t do what you want to do at the moment you value most, it will slip away. The scenery flows and the time and space changes. No matter how hard we try to recall, all we leave is a helpless sigh, “how I liked it at the beginning!”.

At the beginning of the year, my 88 year old grandmother died, which has become my eternal regret. Every spring when flowers bloom, I always want to take advantage of my spare time to take her trembling hand, take her through the mossy slate Road, out of the ancient alley, take her out of the creaking attic, go to the city where I live, see the colorful neons, stand in the high office building, see the flying fireflies on the viaduct, or go to the beach on the edge of the city, Look at the white waves on the beach and the skyline at the end of the sea.

However, this wish has never been realized. My work is getting busier and busier, and there are more and more trivial things at home. Often on Grandma’s birthday, I can only rush back with a cake to have a good meal with her, and then I promise her, “next time, I will take time to take you!” This promise is carefully folded and enshrined in the cellar where there is no sunshine. It is full of dust on miscellaneous days and rots in the dense soil. I didn’t regret until I saw my grandmother lying on the hospital bed getting thinner and thinner, like an old tree with fallen leaves in the autumn wind. I listened to her nagging and vaguely reciting something to me. I let my tears fall.

The past can’t be changed, and the future can’t be guessed. All we can do is now to make the joy and happiness more mellow. Don’t let years run out of fragrance in waiting for empty checks; Don’t appreciate the sadness before you know how to cherish your clothes and the people in front of you. (picture from panorama)

title: Employees were sentenced to seven years for deleting the chain home database. How does the enterprise build internal system security
body:
Southern finance all media reporter Wu Liyang intern Yu Shuhuai reports from Beijing

Han Bing, the database administrator of the former lianjia.com (Beijing) Technology Co., Ltd., was sentenced to seven years’ imprisonment in the first instance and upheld in the second instance for the crime of destroying computer information systems, according to the China judicial documents network.

On June 4, 2018, Han Bing, the database administrator of lianjia.com (Beijing) Technology Co., Ltd., took advantage of his position as the “root” authority of the company’s financial system to log in to the company’s financial system and delete the financial data and related applications in the system, making the company’s financial system completely inaccessible.

It is understood that the damaged servers are the company’s two database servers and two application servers specially used for EBS system. They store all the financial data since the establishment of the company and directly affect the salary payment of the company’s personnel, which is of great significance to the whole operation of the company. The company spent 180000 yuan to recover data and rebuild the system.

He was sentenced to seven years’ imprisonment and the original sentence was upheld in the second instance

According to the testimony of the director of the professional ethics construction center and the senior director of the technical support department of Lianjia company, after the company found that there were problems in the financial system, in order to “check” the response of internal personnel, the computers of five members of the technical support department who had access to the company’s financial system were collected. Except Han Bing, the other four took the initiative to hand in their personal laptops and passwords, Only Han Bing refused to give his laptop password. Later, the company determined that Han Bing was inseparable from the company’s financial system problems and reported the case.

According to the extraction, inspection and identification of the electronic data judicial identification center of the national information center and the judicial identification of Beijing Zhonghai Yixin Information Technology Co., Ltd. on the site of Lianjia company and Han Bing’s apple computer, the host name Yggdrasil and MAC address of the defendant Han Bing’s apple computer are consistent with the access terminal corresponding to the host name and IP address of the equipment accessed by the client ID assigned by the on-site login server on the day of the crime, The court found that in its behavior log on June 4, 2018, it was recorded that it logged in to the financial system to execute the - shred and - RM orders for deletion.

After the identification of computer records and the video materials provided by the chain family, the court of first instance found Han Bing guilty of damaging the computer information system and sentenced him to seven years’ imprisonment. Since then, Han Bing filed an appeal, and his defender believed that the facts of the case were unclear and the evidence was insufficient, which could not rule out reasonable doubt, and the suspected crime should be avoided. However, the court finally rejected the appeal in the second instance and upheld the original judgment.

With regard to the legal basis for the defendant Han Bing being sentenced to seven years’ imprisonment in this case, lawyer Xia Hailong of Shanghai Shenlong law firm analyzed to reporters 21 that according to the provisions of the criminal law, if the perpetrator commits the crime of destroying computer information system, the consequences are particularly serious, he shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of more than five years, According to the relevant provisions of the interpretation of the Supreme People’s court and the Supreme People’s Procuratorate on Several Issues concerning the application of law in handling criminal cases endangering the security of computer information systems, if the perpetrator causes an economic loss of more than 50000 yuan, it belongs to “the consequences are particularly serious”, and the benchmark punishment is more than five years. Based on the above provisions, in this case, Han Bing caused an economic loss of 180000 yuan and deleted the data as high as 9t, which obviously belongs to “the consequences are particularly serious”. He was sentenced to seven years’ imprisonment, which is in line with the provisions of the criminal law.

In addition, whether the perpetrator has the circumstances of voluntary surrender and confession, and whether he pleads guilty or not will affect the final sentencing of the court. The defendant Han Bing refused to admit after deleting 9TB data of the company, and did not cooperate to provide computer and mobile phone passwords. Although the company spent 180000 yuan to repair the data, the circumstances were serious and finally sentenced to seven years’ imprisonment.

It has reflected the problems of the financial system several times, but it has not been paid attention to

In Han Bing’s testimony, the reason for deleting the database was not reflected. However, according to media reports, according to his colleagues, Han Bing found that there were security problems in the company’s financial system during his tenure, and sent an email to Zhang, another database administrator of the chain home. He reported the security problems of the financial system to several leaders twice and suggested that the company start a security project to repair the security problems, but it was not paid attention to.

Two weeks later, the Department of the financial line was assigned to the information line. They reported the security problems of the financial system to Zhou Xiaolong, the leader of the information line, and suggested to start a security project for repair, but it was still not adopted, and even had a dispute with Zhou Xiaolong in the process of making suggestions.

As for the phenomenon that other relevant persons involved ignored the potential safety hazards or did not act, lawyer Xia Hailong said that although there was no connection between the disregard and omission of other personnel of the company to the system risk and the crime committed by the defendant in this case, there was no instigation or assistance, and they did not have to bear criminal responsibility, but other personnel, such as the leaders of the above information line The director of the professional ethics construction center does not pay attention to the hidden danger of data security, and is also likely to violate the company’s internal management regulations or labor contract, so he needs to be liable for compensation to the company for relevant losses.

However, for the criminal act committed by Han Bing himself, the defendant in this case, Lianjia company believes that the slowdown before his engagement and the lack of cooperation with the investigation afterwards are the culprits causing the final loss of the company. The director of the professional ethics construction center of Lianjia company also mentioned in his testimony that Han Bing came to the company in February 2018 to be responsible for the maintenance of the financial system, was transferred to the technical support department in May, and the workplace also changed. Han Bing has a problem with the organizational adjustment and feels that he is not taken seriously. After the adjustment, he slows down. After checking the company’s surveillance video, Han Bing often arrives late and leaves early, and is also absent from work.

In recent years, there have been frequent database deletion incidents in which employees retaliate against the company. How to maintain system security and compliance in the work involving enterprise information security and confidentiality has become particularly important. Lawyer Xia Hailong told reporters 21 that the company should take more effective technical means to strengthen the security protection of internal information system and data, disperse the authority of core system, increase the verification level, formulate a more standardized system security system, fill management loopholes, and avoid database deletion events caused by employees’ personal reasons to the greatest extent.

The discretion and judgment at the legal level are becoming increasingly clear and justified. “For whatever reason, employees’ unauthorized deletion of the company’s information and data is a serious violation of the company’s internal management system and will objectively cause losses to the company. Therefore, they will face the risk of termination of labor relations and compensation for losses

title: My favourite game
body:
I am a child of the 80’s. Born in ’73, my conscious mind really started to take shape in the years defined by E.T, Ghostbusters, Back to the Future and Star Wars…, Nintendo Hardware games (Orange Donkey Kong fold up…;), Big Tall Stereo towers, LP records, Neon Colors and my favorite game at that time… “ONDERUIT”. The game (called “Downfall” in English) is a strategic turn by turn game like Zeeslag (“Battleship”) or Vier op een Rij (“four in a row”), but it had something different to the rest. The gears that you would turn would influence the game of your opponent. I absolutely loved that. The objective of the game would be to unload your two times 5 Tokens that would feed in at the top. By turning the gears, the Tokens would fall into the special token spaces available in each of the 5 gears. You could move the tokens down to the catch reservoir at the bottom. Whoever did that the quickest way would win. I used to play this game a lot with my dad and my sister and had one strategy. I would always try to load up the final gear (which had space for 5 tokens) and prepare my turn to have maximum effect by dropping 5 Tokens in the reservoir at once… freaking out my competition…. In this case usually my sister.

![ONDERUIT / DOWNFALL](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/bOryJqsRX1PNFhCFS8cX6.png?height=220&width=426)

Over the years, my 80’s influenced interests and average high school performance lead me to the doors of the university of Technology in Delft. A pretty overwhelming place for someone who actually just wanted to go to art school, but a place I look back to with much appreciation and gratitude for having the patients with a slow burner like myself.In Delft I learned to design industrial products and services. During my 12,5-year stay (at the time students could pretty much study forever) I learned to control my chaotic creative mind, using the abstract academic frameworks and pathways offered by the faculty of Industrial Design engineering. It took me some time to realize that the PROCESS of DESIGN was actually helping me to give order to my creative mind. Learning to see the difference between ideas, concepts and iterative prototypes and creating options as apposed to single minded focus on one idea, was one of the biggest lessons I took away from that place.

When I started my first solo design company called “RIPPLE” (domain for sale by the way), I started to see the benefits of being able to create order and optionality in a world of entrepreneurial chaos, using frames or guidelines that would show an accountable path towards a desired end goal. This ended up literally becoming what I am still doing for clients today. [But that is another story](https://www.visuallyyours.nl).

It was after some time into my studies, doing assignments and miscellaneous design work for others, that I started to realize that I had developed a pattern of working. My own take on the Delft process of Design. Not a particular good pattern, but one that was similar to my one strategy in the “ONDERUIT” game I shared so enthusiastically at the start of this post.

Before I sat down with a client (or fellow students / professors) I would prepare a whole lot of work overwhelming them with a wall of visuals. Something that looked good and combined our shared perspectives. A story that felt like a credible well thought out direction that was ready to go and be successful. There are all kinds of things you can say about working like that, but for the purpose of this post the moment of sharing a lot of (visual) work is key. The moment I would share my in-between progress would feel exactly like dropping the 5 tokens in the reservoir! My 80’s game strategy when playing that kick-ass two person battle game, ended up becoming my preferred way of working whenever I would share my designs with others.

So now …you might be wondering why I would share this somewhat strange and bizarrely personal revelation with you in a random online post. The stories I am putting together on Mirror.xyz/DENACE.eth are part of a bigger picture that has to do with my own personal way of trying to connect with what I think could be the future of collaboration and personal identity…Web3. But am I ready for what it has to offer? Are my present capabilities ready for the future?

The virtual space we have come to know as the internet has been gaining speed. Both in its technical development and its cultural application. This means that the newer protocols, codes/algorithms and the attention on Artificial Intelligence are kind of forcing me to reevaluate the way I operate. Is the way that I design, the way I interact with others, the way online collaboration across the globe is enabling so many people to work and create so many amazing new things together, is that way compatible with my one strategy….my personal design framework?

What this new space is doing for me now is kind of forcing me to test & challenge my old modus operandi. Does my visual abundance strategy, my desire to overwhelm people with visual work, does it still have a future in Web3?

What I am seeing in my daily design doings is that the new iterations in our shared online space, are just too big to get our heads around. For designers and for our clients alike the promises of new relationships with ownership, responsibility & privacy might give you new reasons to worry, instead of opportunities to take advantage of. In order to understand what is changing and from what angles you can approach the Web3 potential, people will  need guidance or curated pathways to start and understand what the current changes in the landscape might mean for you.

Because it is happening in so many spaces at once, with so many people trying to create ways for you to connect to why it is important, it is a challenge to understand and see how the future of the internet is relevant to you.

These posts on Mirror & Medium will be my quest going forward in the development of small stories, that can show the way. My explorations will try to overwhelm you with a combination of writing and visualization, making it easier to relate to some of the main themes in Web3, like ownership, privacy, trust and collaboration.

My choice for Mirror as a platform lies entirely with Joshua Nuttall, with whom I am sharing the Perpetual Inquiry Journey. Since the beginning of 2021 I have been collaborating with Joshua Nuttall ([josh.mirror.xyz](https://josh.mirror.xyz/)) on a variety of projects in several Thinking domains. Josh has helped me to make my first steps into the realm that is [WEB3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web3) .

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ImddCgfkX61MZtB3-6u3Z.png?height=1340&width=1484)

In the Web3 nature of giving credit to whom it is due:  “ONDERUIT” was made and copyrighted by [MB games](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milton_Bradley_Company). The “ONDERUIT” game in its original form was blue with a gray base. It had orange yellow green and red tokens. As an attempt to personify the game and link it to my way of thinking I changed the colors in photoshop to suit my own branded needs. 

![ONDERUIT by MB games](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8sjd5vbGXYVqrgi5DGoxF.png?height=1714&width=1228)

title: Tens of thousands of yuan to buy internships in financial institutions? Or the grey business of "internal and external collusion"
body:
The third-party platform charges and recommends interns in the financial industry, which has caused a storm. Many institutions have denied the behavior of “charging internal promotion”

“Tens of thousands of yuan to buy internships in financial institutions” is a scam

At the peak of College Students’ summer internship, a third-party platform “clearly priced” was sold to the “disclosure” of internship opportunities in financial institutions, which caused an uproar in the financial circle and college students. In this regard, a number of financial institutions have issued statements denying any form of “fee push” behavior. Some people in the financial industry pointed out that the behavior of “fee pushing” is likely to be a private transaction between internal employees of financial institutions and external third-party institutions.

Internships in well-known financial institutions are the dream of many college graduates. If someone charges you 35000 yuan to recommend internship opportunities for you, will you pay? A few days ago, a microblog revealed that some third-party platforms carried out “fee push” business, which caused an uproar in the financial circle and college students. A number of financial institutions have issued official statements, saying that there is no “fee push” in any form, reminding everyone to apply through formal channels such as the official website. Many people in the financial circle also told the reporter of Beijing Youth Daily that regular financial institutions will not recruit fee interns, and the majority of students should beware of being cheated.

Break the news

Pay 50000 yuan to practice in investment banking companies

The so-called internal push is internal recommendation. When recruiting interns or regular employees, many enterprises are willing to let people inside the company recommend them. This practice can improve the recruitment efficiency, which is equivalent to adding a layer of interpersonal endorsement in addition to the normal examination and investigation. Some financial institutions also encourage internal employees to recommend talents for the company, and even reward the successful referrals. Originally, the recruitment information of these enterprises was completely open and the recruitment process was all free, but some platforms saw “business opportunities” to start the business of charging and pushing.

According to the information exposed on Weibo, some training institutions taking “financial partners” as an example are actually selling internship opportunities for financial institutions in the name of job guidance for interns, involving many financial institutions, including some well-known banks and securities companies.

Beiqing Daily reporter found that most large-scale platforms do not directly price internship opportunities, but are keen to launch expensive training packages.

In the “breaking news” of Weibo, a screenshot of an article from the “financial partner” official account shows that the training institution provides four different levels of packages with different charging standards, including courses and practical training (four weeks offline + two weeks offline), with a quotation of 11800 yuan; Online elite apprenticeship package (online training + 1-to-1 remote internship, recommendation letter can be provided), with a quotation of 15800 yuan. There are also exclusive packages and Xingyao packages requiring private letter inquiry, including courses and training + unlimited internships + two-year VIP + school recruitment VIP, etc.

On another platform called “disciple job search”, the reporter of Beiqing daily found that it launched the disciple plan of “ensuring to obtain internship 0ffer (employment)”, claiming that this plan is a “carefully built high-end private customized” project. This project aims at job matching for resumes, targeting target positions, whether remote, on-site, formal or full-time, and all positions in investment banks, public funds and foreign investment consulting. It also claims “accidental failure, full refund” in an “atmosphere”. As for the price, it is a single post, single pricing, and the price varies. A person who has contacted the job consultant of the platform disclosed that the quotation of the platform for different companies and positions ranges from 20000 to 60000 yuan.

The reporter of Beiqing daily also found that a few platforms that mainly promote through wechat even play the push price directly on the leaflet. For example, in a third-party organization’s “fee push” standard circulated on the Internet, investment banks, consulting, accounting firms, banks, FMCG and the Internet in the financial industry are covered. The companies cited include state-owned banks, four major accounting firms, well-known securities companies, Chinese funded and foreign-funded enterprises. The internship opportunities of FMCG and Internet companies with the lowest price are 19800 yuan, while the internship opportunities of investment banking companies need up to 52800 yuan.

investigation

At least more than a dozen platforms engaged in “charging internal promotion”

According to the incomplete statistics of the reporter of Beiqing daily, there are at least more than ten third-party institutions with some fame and scale engaged in similar internal push internship charging business.

Netizens who have worked on similar platforms broke the news that these charging platforms are mainly for college students with internship and employment needs, and all provide various paid services and packages with clearly marked prices. The service content is also diverse, fully covering the full range of needs of job seekers. For example, basic training such as modifying resumes, delivering resumes, online interview skills training and career planning consulting are generally cheaper. The most attractive is the plan that can push inward and even guarantee offer. Generally, the charge is 5 digits.

These platforms will “viral” share the circle of friends, pull target customers into the group, and then send some articles and information in the group every day to attract everyone to buy services. The modification of resume is generally 100-400 yuan, and the help of professional HR (Human Resource Management) is 500-1000 yuan. Targeted internship posts are priced according to different situations. Ordinary securities companies are priced at 10000-20000 yuan. The higher the reputation, the higher the price. For example, a Chinese prefix securities company pushes a price of 45000 yuan, and those with good performance have room for retention; The internship position of the top investment bank in China is 60000 yuan, and the internship is guaranteed for 3 months.

clarify

Many financial institutions say it has nothing to do with the charging platform

After microblogging exposed the industry chaos of “fee push” internship, many financial institutions issued public statements saying they had no cooperative relationship with these platforms.

UBS group said in a statement that it has no cooperative relationship with any training unit, group or individual to internally recommend resumes, and has never edited, published or released any recruitment examination reference materials. UBS careers official website is the only official recruitment channel of the group in mainland China. Applicants who are interested in applying for UBS group apply for positions through official channels to guard against fraud. UBS Group reserves the right to investigate the legal liability of the publisher of false information.

title: How can the 30 + difference between the two groups save the ratings
body:
On May 11, Beijing time, the NBA playoffs reached the division semi-finals. With the deepening of the series, three of the four groups entered Tianwang mountain. Today, the two groups of G5 duels ended with a huge difference, and the game scene was once ugly.

In the early game between the 76ers and the heat, although the home team lacked core guard Kyle Lowry, it established an advantage early. When the game entered the last quarter, it had an advantage of about 20 points.

Even in the last five minutes, both sides put on pure substitutes. Finally, the heat broke the opponent with 35 points and won the victory.

A little later, the sun swept the lone ranger crazily in the second half. The third quarter became a turning point. In the last four minutes of the last quarter, both sides sent a rotation team, and the game lost suspense early.

The two battles of Tianwang mountain did not win at the last minute, and the fourth quarter was reduced to garbage time. The league has always had certain expectations for ratings, but from today’s duel between the two groups, it does not reflect the intensity of competitive sports. The garbage time came in advance and the situation between the two sides ended hastily. I don’t know how to deal with the key G5 match between the bucks and the Celtics tomorrow after watching such Tianwang mountain for the NBA.

title: NFT防骗指南 How to Stay Safe From NFT Scams
body:
几天前美国演员Seth Green发推特表示自己的钱包被盗，其中被盗的NFT总价值将近150ETH，包含一个BAYC，两个MAYC，一个Doodles。与此同时今日多个NFT项目的DC也被遭到骇客攻击并被恶意利用，那么我们如何提高自己的防骗意识呢？简单总结了以下几种常见的NFT骗局，我们来一起看一下。

常见的骗局主要分布在四个地方，Twitter，Opensea，Discord，我们一个一个来看。

首先是Twitter，很多小伙伴经常会参与一些转发抽奖NFT白名单的活动，于是市场上就出现了很多仿冒各种官方的账号@你告诉你中奖了。像这个账号，经常能够收到各种各样的消息@说你中奖了快来看一看，基本上你看一下他们的关注人都很少.也有一些假账号买了粉丝点进去你看到也有几十万粉丝，但是你的关注列表里一个人都没关注，这显然是不合理的。所以像推特上收到这种消息，全部无视就好了。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Vgjc-zoLWwtdb2NQAmh-n.png?height=956&width=1000)

如果想要完全屏蔽一些陌生人的@，你可以到「账号设置」中，「隐私和安全」里「受众和圈人」，「照片圈人」中设置只有你关注的人才可以圈你就好了。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jGtYFE__VWC5Cgqg_bcH8.png?height=1052&width=2130)

有时候骇客会黑掉一些KOL的推特发放假链接，像之前比较出名的事情是骇客做了一个假网站钓鱼，因为推特账号带有验证标识，很多人看到以后想都没想就去链接了，那钱包就很容易被盗。比如说像前两天Beeple的推特也黑了，骇客发布的假链接导致很多人点击以后直接给骇客打钱。所以遇到这个事情，我们还是要再三核对官方账号的链接，以及授权时看清楚操作。那也许也有很多人说官方账号也有被盗的风险呀。是的，所以其实最好的办法是准备一个冷钱包，这个钱包只进不出用来储存大金额或者是贵重的NFT，并且不随便连接任何网站是最安全的。那在你的交易钱包里放的金额也不要太多，准备多个小钱包，对于一些风险很高的项目或者是外来链接，最好使用最小的那个钱包。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8Q1ZZMtUKQRQ4xRsUAuYH.png?height=1284&width=954)

文件诈骗也是一种常见的手段，比较常见的是发生在一些KOL的身上，很多骇客会私信KOL或者发邮件请求一些合作的事宜，并且带上一些附件文档。这些文档很有可能潜藏一些病毒，能够控制你电脑上的钱包，如果你恰好没有锁定钱包，那很有可能就会被盗。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/p0PnhFlRLR7CZLUk9Ucsm.png?height=986&width=956)

再来说说Opensea上常见的一些骗局吧。

像BAYC#6242最近发生的一次交易，我们看到竟然是以200USDC的价格成交，如果这个卖家真的是看错了而成交，我只能说这次骗子捡到大便宜了。我们经常可以看到自己的NFT得到别人的出价，请一定要看清楚交易的单位.那么除了USDC还有一些货币比如$DAI，$Ape也是常见的单位。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CdO-11AHq12IaVDsAwjy-.png?height=824&width=1090)

有时候我们在Opensea上发现自己的钱包莫名其妙空投了一些NFT，并且这些NFT看起来价值不菲。我们首先需要去确认一下是否是来自官方项目方空投并且确认项目地址，如果是一些一眼就特别垃圾的NFT，比如我这个钱包，我把收到的垃圾NFT全部都Hide了。天下没有免费的午餐，谁会把钱直接送到你嘴里呢？除此之外不要做任何的操作，就让这些垃圾NFT烂在你钱包里，你的任何操作都有可能导致自己的钱包不小心误授权，从而失去你所有的资产。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eOzZh9cGGkxDq0XbpVXvB.png?height=862&width=2680)

另外还有一些针对大佬的一些钓鱼攻击，骇客会仿冒Opensea官方邮件，告诉你恭喜你的账号获得加V认证许可了，现在需要你去链接钱包认证，这也是一个骗局。OpenSea 只会要求电子邮件的账户验证，并不会涉及到任何钱包的操作。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/YS8clj-BEgXi4o3zvSepE.jpg?height=1194&width=1000)

Discord上的骗局也不少，很多人在加入NFT项目的Discord的时候会收到各种各样的“管理员”私信告诉你恭喜获得了项目的白名单，现在铸造正在进行中，快点去”官网“铸造吧。可以说99%项目的管理员是不会私信你的，私信你的都是骗子。如果你真的获得了白名单，你一定会在Discord的频道中被@，或者是获得一个代表白名单的Role。并且基本上所有项目你在进入Discord的时候都是可以查看到铸造时间的。另外，就我个人的观点，如果说一个项目到了铸造时期还在送白名单，我觉得这个项目属于比较失败的，要么是没有人气，要么是Rug项目。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ib6T-78OLaX0rYLdwtZ7L.png?height=776&width=920)

有时候会遇到看似也是NFT爱好者给你发私信，先把你的某个NFT夸一遍然后提出想要用他手上的某个NFT跟你做交换，问你是否愿意。这里会有两个坑，第一个坑，他可能会发给你NFT交换的网站，这个网站是有问题的，你链接以后你的钱包被盗。另一个坑是你们在交换的时候，你以为你达成了笔划算的交换，实际上对方发给你的可能是同图不同合约地址的NFT，这个需要千万注意，合约地址是检验NFT真伪的唯一方式。

除了私信会发送一些假消息以外，还要注意Bot的消息，Discord上也存在很多假的Bot。比如在你进入到Discord需要验证钱包的时候，假的Bot会给你发来链接。这里去分辨真假Bot的方法很简单，我们只要记住真Bot后面的几位数字，或者是我们给真Bot加上备注信息，每次点击的时候看一眼备注确保是真的再做操作即可。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Jx33Enh3GLa6SnRYCvrlY.jpg?height=571&width=1000)

另外经常也有官方Bot被黑的事件，像前几天Meet 6 Bot被黑，并遭到骇客的恶意利用。对于如果是遇到这种情况，请快速去断开网站链接并且去Revoke取消任何授权，或许还是有可能挽回的。通常我们去[revoke.cash](https://revoke.cash/) 这个网站去取消授权。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/J_4zEdNEPnNxIZeYb3Fuq.png?height=1896&width=3360)

title: Harvey on Harland joining Manchester City: economically, we can't compete with Manchester City
body:
Harvey was interviewed after the 3-1 victory over CELTA.

Speaking of the game, Harvey said: “we didn’t play well, but we still got three points. It’s not a good feeling. We didn’t play well. We have to understand the requirements of the game. We need more ball rights in the other half. It’s difficult for the players to understand the concept of free man. We lack the simplicity required. But the team is efficient and we’re still fighting for second place.”

“We have some important players missing, such as pique, pedry and Busquets, which affects the team. Nevertheless, we must play easily and more succinctly. Don’t lose so many goals.”

Harvey praised demberle, who scored twice in assists: “sometimes he plays a decisive role, not only in scoring goals, but also in creating goals. Demberle almost helps the team rewrite the score to 1-0 by himself. In football, not only scoring goals, his assists can also play a decisive role.”

For Araujo, who suffered a concussion during the game, Harvey said that the players were kept in the hospital for observation overnight, but it was OK.

On the news that Manchester City signed Harland, Harvey said: “that’s what I said yesterday. I wish Harland all the best. We can’t compete with them, we can’t compete financially. I wish him all the best.”
